briefTitle: ECG Belt to Assess Electrical Synchronization
officialTitle: ECG Belt to Assess Electrical Synchronization in Patients With Left Bundle Branch Pacing and His-Purkinje Conduction System Optimized Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (ECG Belt)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Patients \> 18 years of age
2. Patient has a previously implanted LBBP lead for bradycardia indication or heart failure indication with one of the following at Geisinger within the last 5 years:

   * LBBP
   * LBBP+LV lead
   * HBP+LV
3. Patient is willing to comply with all study procedures and be available for the duration of the study.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Inability to provide informed consent
2. Pregnant
3. Enrolled in a concurrent study that may confound the results of this study.

primary.measure: • ECG Belt Analysis of Standard Deviation of Activation Times (SDAT) of LBBP Compared to Native Conduction
primary.description: Change in SDAT following LBBP measured in ms using ECG Belt

primary.measure: • ECG Belt Analysis of Left Ventricular Activations Times (LVAT) of LBBP Compared to Baseline
primary.description: Change in LV activation times measured in ms using ECG Belt

primary.measure: • ECG Belt Analysis of QRS Duration at Baseline Compared to Various LBBP Options
primary.description: Change in QRS duration measured in ms using ECG Belt

primary.measure: • ECG Belt Analysis of LV Dispersion of HOT-CRT Compared to Baseline
primary.description: LV dispersion measured using ECG Belt

primary.measure: • ECG Belt Analysis of RV Dispersion of HOT-CRT Compared to Baseline
primary.description: RV dispersion measured using ECG Belt
